Steps.Message: Update at 10:47 - Sorry the power is still off this morning. Our engineers are still working on a higher than normal amount of faults in the area due to Storm Bella. They are working job to job and updating us as soon as they can. They can be working at heights in dangerous conditions, so will only contact us when it is safe to do so. This means the text updates you will receive are less frequent than we would normally send.  As soon as we have any news we will be in touch. In the meantime, if you have  a vulnerable person at home or rely on electric for medical devices, please call us on 08003163105 and we'll see if we can provide any additional support Or contact your out of hours GP / NHS non-emergency number 111

We became aware of this power cut at 05:14. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We were investigating a high voltage overhead electricity line fault which caused a power cut in the local area.
